> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/228?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [aedfdb3...ae6a846](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/228?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Someone already filed an [issue](https://github.com/nedbat/coveragepy/issues/772) related to `break` not being recognized in coverage, so I guess there really wasn't an alternative to adding a `no cover`.
This is great, thanks @pim-hoeven ! I've noticed that issue with break myself.
